topic.title: Memory and Storage
topic.shortdesc: Couchbase Server provides a caching layer to facilitate high-speed data-access; and tunable disk I/O priorities, supported by multi-threaded readers and writers.

section.title: Caching and Persistence
section.p: Couchbase Server provides a fully integrated caching layer, which provides high-speed data-access. Couchbase Server automatically manages the caching layer, ensuring that sufficient memory is available in relation to occupied disk-space, in order to maintain optimal performance. Data associated with Couchbase buckets is also maintained persistenly, on disk. Such items, when they come into the caching layer, are placed onto the disk queue, to be written to disk; and at the same time, if appropriate, are placed on a replication queue, so that one or more replica buckets can be created or updated accordingly.

Memory quotas, established by the Full Administrator when the server is configured, are automatically managed by Couchbase Server with reference to watermarks, which specify how much free memory should be consistently maintained within the caching layer. Consequently, infrequently used items are written to disk; are then removed from memory in order to free up space; and are subsequently re-acquired from disk as necessary. This process, referred to as ejection, is managed asynchronously, while the server continues to service active requests.
A working-set of most frequently used data is tracked and maintained, and the items kept in memory to ensure high performance.
